bug.author: ghost(ghost)
bug.description:
Using v1.4.1 I have a 30k row file with about 90 variables and attempting to run a profile gives an error of "Process ForkPoolWorker-4:" (numbers vary). PyCharm then seems to just hang, and if I kill the process the following trace is generated. <denchmark-code>Process ForkPoolWorker-4: Process ForkPoolWorker-8: Process ForkPoolWorker-3: Process ForkPoolWorker-2: Process ForkPoolWorker-7: Process ForkPoolWorker-6: Process ForkPoolWorker-9: Process ForkPoolWorker-1: Process ForkPoolWorker-10: Process ForkPoolWorker-5: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/martincampbell/BitBucket/marketoneanalysistask/initial_data_exploration.py", line 33, in <module> Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/local/Cellar/python3/3.6.4_2/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.6/lib/python3.6/multiprocessing/process.py", line 258, in _bootstrap self.run() File Based on another issue I saw I've tried check_correlation=False but it doesn't make a difference.

comments.comment: Having the same issue I'm running profiling on celery After adding logs I see that after starting describing 4 (4 is the pool size) columns (out of 13) it failed Same when pool size is 1
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ericman93>@ericman93</denchmark-link> Could you open a new issue as it is related, but probably not the same (as I expect you use pandas-profiling v2+).
